alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 8:07PM PDT until July 05 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected as we experience a summer King Tide event now into the early morning hours of Wednesday. The peak high tides will occur late at night between 11 pm to 1 am each night and this is when the flooding of low lying spots is likely to occur on the Bay-side of North Bay counties. * WHERE...Bayside coasts of Marin, Sonoma, and Napa counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest risk for minor flooding is during high tide cycles between 10 PM and 2 AM each night. Lower than normal low tides will occur between 5 and 8 AM each morning. These impacts are most likely within bayside portions of Marin County and for low lying portions of the Delta.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
